name: HiveMind v3.0 Frontend - OpenTUI Dashboard
description: Frontend implementation: OpenTUI Dashboard migration, 5 views, bilingual EN/VI, Stitch design integration. JULES team: clone dev-v3, work remote sequential.

userStories.title: Migrate from Ink to OpenTUI
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the dashboard migrated from Ink to OpenTUI for better TUI capabilities.
userStories.notes: Use skill: opentui for API reference

userStories.title: Build TelemetryHeader component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a header showing session ID, mode, governance status, drift score, and language toggle.
acceptanceCriteria: Display: session ID (short), mode, governance status
Use <text> with nested <strong>, <em>, <span> for styling (NOT props)

userStories.title: Build TrajectoryPane component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a pane showing the current trajectory > tactic > action hierarchy.

userStories.title: Build MemoryPane component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a pane showing relevant mems with shelf, staleness, and type indicators.
acceptanceCriteria: Display mems from cognitive packer output

userStories.title: Build AutonomicLog component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a log showing autonomic hook activity (tool calls, violations, drift warnings).

userStories.title: Build InteractiveFooter component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a footer with keyboard shortcuts and action prompts.
acceptanceCriteria: Display keyboard shortcuts: [M] Mem, [A] Anchor, [C] Compact, [Q] Quit
React to key presses: emit events or trigger actions

userStories.title: Build SwarmMonitor component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see active sub-agent swarms and their status.
acceptanceCriteria: Status per swarm: RUNNING, COMPLETE, FAILED

userStories.title: Create slash command entry point
userStories.description: As a user, I want to launch the dashboard via a slash command.

userStories.title: Dashboard accessibility and responsiveness
userStories.description: As a user, I want the dashboard to adapt to terminal resize and be keyboard-accessible.

userStories.title: Dashboard tests
userStories.description: As a developer, I want comprehensive tests for the OpenTUI dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Test: component rendering, keyboard interaction, state updates
Use OpenTUI test renderer (see skill: opentui/references/testing/)

userStories.title: Build i18n/bilingual infrastructure
userStories.description: As a user, I want the dashboard to support English and Vietnamese with keyboard toggle.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/dashboard/i18n.ts with EN and VI dictionaries
Technical terms preserved (UUID, XML, JSON, FK)

userStories.title: Build SwarmOrchestratorView component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a view showing ASCII agent topology and communication bus.
acceptanceCriteria: ASCII topology: 9-column grid with agent positions
Use <code> component for JSON with language=json

userStories.title: Build TimeTravelDebuggerView component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a view for navigating state history with diff viewer.
acceptanceCriteria: Use native <diff> component: oldCode, newCode, mode=unified|split

userStories.title: Build ToolRegistryView component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a view showing all available tools and their schemas.

userStories.title: Build MemCreationModal component
userStories.description: As a user, I want a modal for creating mems with form fields.

userStories.title: Implement dashboard view navigation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to navigate between the 5 dashboard views with keyboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Views: Main, SwarmOrchestrator, TimeTravelDebugger, ToolRegistry, Settings

userStories.title: Dashboard design system (TUI tokens)
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a consistent design system with neon color tokens matching Stitch screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Colors: neon-green (#00ff41), neon-amber (#ffb000), neon-blue (#00f0ff), neon-purple (#bd00ff), neon-pink (#ff0055), neon-red (#ff3333)
Animated status dots via useTimeline() hook
